com.rohanclan.cfml.editors.contentassist
Interface IAssistContributor

All Known Implementing Classes:
CFMLFunctionAssist, CFMLScopeAssist, CFMLTagAssist, DefaultTagAssistContributor
public interface IAssistContributor

All clients that wish to provide assist for documents should implement this interface. Plugins should register their contributors with the CFE core (please see ... for registration information).


The CFE core assistors compute the assist state information that is kept in a class derived from AssistState. The assistor then calls each assist contributor for a specific assist type (tag, attribute, attr value, etc.) and asks it whether it will contribute. Once the list of contributors that will contribute is gathered they will have their getProposals() called. The core assist will perform some finalising on the gathered contributions and present them to the user. The gathering process is based upon a first-come, first-serve method. This type of contributor will be asked to contribute every time the user invokes content assist in a CFML context where they're not after attribute or attribute value insight. You may, of course, implement this interface and the attribute/ attribute insight assist interfaces.

Author:
Oliver Tupman

Method Summary
 org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.ICompletionProposal[] getTagProposals(IAssistState state)
          Determines whether the assist wishes to contribute to the current proposals.
 

Method Detail

getTagProposals

public org.eclipse.jface.text.contentassist.ICompletionProposal[] getTagProposals(IAssistState state)
Determines whether the assist wishes to contribute to the current proposals. Not sure whether this is really needed as getProposals() would need to provide the same information as to whether it would trigger so getProposals() could just return a 0 length array or null.

Parameters:
state - The state of the assist
Returns:
An array of completion proposals
